title: How to Make a Beer Pizza Base

steps.headline: Sift the flour and salt together.
Mix in the beer.
steps.description: Add enough to achieve a smooth and pliable consistency.

steps.headline: Cover the bowl with a clean tea towel.
steps.description: Place the bowl in a warm place for about half an hour, or until the dough has risen.

steps.headline: Once risen, punch down the dough and knead for a few minutes.
Roll out evenly.
steps.description: Place the dough on the pizza tray. Press the pizza dough out to the edges to fit using your fingertips. Cut off any excess and add that to the roll out of the next pizza base.

steps.headline: Spread pasta sauce over the base and add toppings.
Bake in the oven at 180ºC/350ºF.
steps.description: A typical pizza will require around 25–30 minutes but you will need to keep an eye on its cooking rate, depending on your toppings.

text: Sift the flour and salt together.  Mix in the beer. Add enough to achieve a smooth and pliable consistency. Cover the bowl with a clean tea towel. Place the bowl in a warm place for about half an hour, or until the dough has risen. Once risen, punch down the dough and knead for a few minutes.  Roll out evenly. Place the dough on the pizza tray. Press the pizza dough out to the edges to fit using your fingertips. Cut off any excess and add that to the roll out of the next pizza base. Spread pasta sauce over the base and add toppings.  Bake in the oven at 180ºC/350ºF. A typical pizza will require around 25–30 minutes but you will need to keep an eye on its cooking rate, depending on your toppings. Finished.
